attributes.action: Prosecute MPs who have fraudulently claimed expenses
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Over the past few days MP have delivered grovelling apologies for cheating the public. They claim to be forgetful or poor at accounting. If they are canny enough to make the claims in the first place they are canny enough to know when they are cheating the people they are paid to serve.

Benefit cheats are prosecuted for falsely claiming public funds. MPs are worse - they have cheated us out of far more than the average benefit fraudster. MPs must be prosecuted!

rejection.details: Government cannot prosecute individuals or organisations. It is the role of the police to investigate suspected crimes, and the role of the Crown Prosecution Service to decide whether there is a case to answer, and to prosecute.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
